title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based SQL Query Writing Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. SQL practical training conducted in a smartphone-centric learning environment

learning_goals: By the end of the 4-week midterm course, learners accurately express three complexity levels (simple/intermediate/complex) of information requests in pseudo-SQL and implement them with ≥80% accuracy via peer review and instructor verification.

Using given data models (e.g., ERD) and query templates (SELECT, JOIN, subqueries), learners write ≥3 complex SQL queries (e.g., multi-table joins, aggregate functions) and achieve ≥80% scores based on instructor-provided criteria (accuracy, readability, performance).
Develop the ability to extract required data from relational databases applied in real social science research scenarios

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
